item.title: Why you should use zod as your validator
item.description: The title is just to bring some attention… I know, you use what you want, but today I’ll be giving some insights on zod, from someone that is using it daily for the last 6-8 months. To keep it simple, I’m gonna omit most of the express app setup because it’s kinda easy to do, however you can find it in their documentation. Installation $ npm i zod express typescript body-parser $ npm i -g npx $ npx tsc --init $ npm i --save-dev @types/express Let’s say that you have an express api with a /user endpoint.
